definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
to report (malefactors to the police)/to denounce
a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold

sentences.english: For example, think of a Frisbee.
sentences.chinese: 舉個例子，就看看飛盤吧。

sentences.english: The easiest way to look at this is just to do an example.
sentences.chinese: 要想理解這點最簡單的方法就是舉個例子。

sentences.english: What are the different types of determiners?Please give two example of your own for each type.
sentences.chinese: 請就每個類別各舉兩個你自己的例子。

sentences.english: Do you care to  give us an example?
sentences.chinese: 您介不介意給我們舉個例子？

sentences.english: The non-symmetrical AHP method is demonstrated with good feasibility.
sentences.chinese: 最後，舉一個實例來驗證這一方法的可行性。

sentences.english: That means avoiding the use of sarcasm or putdowns, for example.
sentences.chinese: 舉個例，那就是說，避免使用諷刺或。

sentences.english: Finally, two examples are given to illustrate the application of the results.
sentences.chinese: 文未，舉兩例說明結果的應用。

sentences.english: And last year, he criticised women who pray at the Western Wall as "stupid".
sentences.chinese: 去年他又指責婦女在哭牆祈禱是愚蠢之舉。

sentences.english: The trouble is that Bernanke’s stimulus spending was a blunderbuss.
sentences.chinese: 麻煩在於伯南克推行消費刺激政策實乃草率之舉。

sentences.english: And we must make certain that they are no longer perceived as risk-free.
sentences.chinese: 而且我們必須確保不讓它再被視爲是無風險之舉。

sentences.english: Stretch your arms over your head.
In Kenya , for example, panel cookers are being manufactured for just $2.
sentences.chinese: 舉個例子，在肯尼亞，面板式爐具的製作僅需2美元。

sentences.english: Communication may be the key to a successful transition to a smoke-free hospital, they concluded.
sentences.chinese: 溝通也許是成功過渡到禁菸醫院的關鍵之舉。

sentences.english: They raised their hands up straight, so that the teacher could see them.
sentences.chinese: 他們把手舉起來伸直，好讓老師看見。

sentences.english: Post allowance system (PAS) is an innovation method of distribution system in college and university.
sentences.chinese: 高校崗位津貼制度是高校分配製度的創新之舉。

sentences.english: She may feel, for example, palpitations and hot flushes.
sentences.chinese: 她也許會感到，舉個例子來說吧，心悸，潮熱。

definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
